task_summary: A robot recognizes a lid, approaches, opens it, verifies success, and retreats.

task_long_description.overview: This episode shows a robot tasked with opening a visible lid. The contact sheet frames reveal a white, round object centered against a blue background, which the robot identifies, approaches, manipulates to open, and then retreats from after the lid has been removed. The primary object is the lid; there are no obvious handles, but the robot uses container opening primitives. Task constraints are standard: only one target, robust perception, and positive verification.
preconditions: The lid is visually accessible on a blue surface.
No obstructions prevent the robot from approaching.
The robot gripper or end-effector is free.
stepwise_plan: Move above the lid in preparation.
Open the lid using a suitable container-opening primitive.
success_criteria: Lid is visibly and/or physically open.
No damage to the lid or surroundings.
Robot successfully retreats to a safe distance.
failure_and_recovery: Lid not detected: Attempt re-detection sequence.
Lid fails to open: Reattempt manipulation or escalate.
Opening not verified: Repeat verify or abort with error.
task_long_description.termination: The task ends after verifying the lid is open and robot has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the lid is visible to the vision system.
Attempts to detect the lid using vision.
Moves to a position above the lid, 5cm clearance.
Approaches the lid and aligns precisely for opening.
Executes the primitive to open the lid container.
Retreats 10cm from the workspace after opening.

failure_modes: Verification that lid is open fails
assumptions: Frames are of a single white lid against a blue background, matching 'lid' in the instruction.
No explicit force/tolerance/strategy is specified in the instruction or visible from the frames.
Container type determined by context and object geometry in images.
If the lid is not detected, DetectObject is executed; if approach fails, recovery is by retry within the episode.
No explicit retries specified by the instruction or by visual evidence.

expected_success_criteria: Lid is confirmed as open after execution
Robot does not interfere with the environment after retreat
